Article.Title: 11:11 Always
Article.Summary: Looks like I finally got something working. Why can't I be happy
Article.Contents: I can do a few more tweaks but I'm at a point where I could push something up. Now it's time for me to make use of this thing Just a few more to add, Paging on the list filtering of the list Make the list the home page These are things I can add later if they don't effect content.

Article.Title: Now That we have Trump
Article.Summary: Yes He's a con-man but let's make the best of it.
Article.Contents: The economy is doing well. Maybe the trade wars are good.

Article.Title: To Transcend Sequential Time
Article.Summary: What if a life form advanced so far that it figured out to actually reach eternity? The concept requires placing the infinite universe of atoms and galaxies in a bucket next to non three dimensional sequential time.
Article.Contents:
It's not a function of how long a life form exists. They say sharks and alligators have been around for hundreds of millions of years. What really matters is if the advance intellectually.

But imagine if a life form that developed cognitively to the point where they were able to grapple with non three dimensional space time. Where would they go? That is the topic of my book Time Squared.

Article.Title: quill try 8
Article.Contents:
Methods

getContents(index: Number = 0, length: Number = remaining): Delta

Examples

var delta = quill.getContents();

getLength

Retrieves the length of the editor contents. Note even when Quill is empty, there is still a blank line represented by ‘\n’, so getLength will return 1.

Methods

getLength(): Number

Examples

Article.Title: Asimov Tribute Page
Article.Contents:
I do everything except actually use this thing. OK I fixed the time. Now what? I got paging working and the home page loads a lot faster,

I got the date display and the date sort order working, I put the service location in the web config.

Now maybe I don't need to add date edit to this page. But since I put stuff in from long ago I could use it.

Still need to

  1. put categories in a table
  2. add a Hit counter
  3. add an admin form to update categories
  4. it's time to put the carosel back
  5. pages for all footer links

Article.Title: Fix Dates
Article.Summary: I may need a javascript utility or should I say a c# class
Article.Contents:
//article.DateCreated = Convert.ToDateTime(node.Attributes["DateCreated"].InnerText).ToString("MM/dd/yyyy");

           article.Id = Id;

           article.Title = node.Attributes["Title"].InnerText;

           article.Category = node.Attributes["Category"].InnerText;

           article.Byline = node.Attributes["ByLine"].InnerText;

           article.ImageName = node.Attributes["ImageName"].InnerText;

           article.LastUpdated = node.Attributes["LastUpdated"].InnerText;

           article.Summary = node.ChildNodes[0].InnerText;

           article.Contents = node.ChildNodes[1].InnerText;

           return Json(article);

       }

       [HttpPost]

       public string Post(ArticleModel model)

       {

           try

           {

               XmlDocument xdoc = new XmlDocument();

               xdoc.Load(fileName);

               XmlNode xmlNode = null;

               string id = Guid.NewGuid().ToString();

               xmlNode = xdoc.CreateElement("Article");

               XmlAttribute articleId = xdoc.CreateAttribute("Id"); articleId.Value = id; xmlNode.Attributes.Append(articleId);

               XmlAttribute title = xdoc.CreateAttribute("Title"); title.Value = model.Title; xmlNode.Attributes.Append(title);

               XmlAttribute category = xdoc.CreateAttribute("Category"); category.Value = model.Category; xmlNode.Attributes.Append(category);

               XmlAttribute byLine = xdoc.CreateAttribute("ByLine"); byLine.Value = model.Byline; xmlNode.Attributes.Append(byLine);

               XmlAttribute imageName = xdoc.CreateAttribute("ImageName"); imageName.Value = model.ImageName; xmlNode.Attributes.Append(imageName);

               XmlElement summary = xdoc.CreateElement("Summary"); sum

Article.Title: All Out War On SCOTUS Nomination
Article.Summary: The negotiations, the mistaken identity campaign. All it takes is one Senator to flip. Imagine the pressure being exerted to keep them all in line. How much money is it worth? Why is it so important to the Republicans?
Article.Contents: The reasons why the Democrats and most thinking people are against this nomination are easily apparent to me. Kavanaugh is a hard core partisan warrior. It really come down to metal.

Article.Title: The Emerald Tablet
Article.Contents:
The Emerald Tablet
The legend of Thrice Great Hermes Trismegistus, a Greek translation of the Egyptian god of Knowledge Troth, has suffered from the slight detail that essentially all of this, greatest store of wisdom has been lost. As a result, throughout the Dark Ages, and up until recent times, lots of bogus alchemy and witchcraft, and all manner of weird and crazy stuff has been passed off as "Hermetic Writings" Although it may be dozens of hundreds of years old in some cases, it none the less remains thousands of years more recent than any actual ancient wisdom, if indeed there ever was any, except for one tiny scrap.

The Emerald Tablet seems to have survived, even though it too seems now lost to the public. The Emerald Tablet, the Tabula Smaragdina, may have survived longer than most all else precisely because it seems it was quite literally carved in stone, on a slab of green desert glass.



1) It is true without untruth, certain and most true:
2) that which is below is like that which is on high, and that which is on high is like that which is below; by these things are made the miracles of one thing.
3) And as all things are, and come from One, by the mediation of One, So all things are born
from this unique thing by adaption.
4) The Sun is the father and the Moon the mother.
5) The wind carries it in its stomach. The earth is its nourisher and its receptacle.
6 The Father of all the Theleme of the universal world is here.
6a) Its force, or power, remains entire,
7) if it is converted into earth.
7a) You separate the earth from the fire, the subtle from the gross, gently with great
industry.
8) It climbs from the earth and descends from the sky, and receives the force of things
superior and things inferior.
9) You will have by this way, the glory of the world and all obscurity will flee from you.
10) It is the power strong with all power, for it will defeat every subtle thing and penetrate
every solid thing
11a) In this way the world was created.
12) From it are born wonderful adaptations, of which the way here is given.
13) That is why I have been called Hermes Tristmegistus, having the three parts of the
universal philosophy.
14) This, that I have called the solar Work, is complete.


As Above So Below. By these things all are made one. Many people might focus on this second observation, that there is a oneness beneath all the strife and diversity and difference and uniqueness of physical life here on Earth, and this is a worthy avenue of philosophical investigation, one that especially benefits from the application of mind altering drugs, I might add. However, it is the often overlooked first statement, "Above So Below," that most intrigues me, because it supports my Animal House Theory of the Cosmos, that our Solar System is but an atom, our universe but a molecule, and that we exist within the small intestines of some vast organism to which a million years is but a fraction of a second, and under our fingernails exist untold tropical oceans.

Article.Title: Go Away
Article.Summary: I have better things to do
